news.title: Facebook Asked Banks to Share Data on Their Customers
news.summary: Facebook has asked banks to share detailed financial information about customers, including account balances, as it seeks to boost user engagement. Facebook shares climbed sharply on the news.
news.byline: Emily Glazer, Deepa Seetharaman and AnnaMaria Andriotis

news.title: Tech Giants Embrace the Unthinkable: Privacy Legislation
news.summary: U.S. tech companies are hoping to get ahead of the public and legal fallout by working with policy makers to help shape potential new federal privacy legislation.
news.byline: John D. McKinnon and Marc Vartabedian

news.title: U.S. to Reimpose Sanctions on Iran
news.summary: The measures are the first economic action President Trump has taken against Iran since announcing in May the U.S. was quitting the 2015 Iran nuclear accord.
news.byline: Michael R. Gordon and Vivian Salama

news.title: Pepsi CEO Nooyi to Step Down; Veteran Set to Take Helm
news.summary: PepsiCo’s longtime leader Indra Nooyi will step aside as CEO at a time when shifting consumer tastes are roiling the soda and snacks markets.

news.title: Goldman Banker Takes On World’s Largest Gold Miner—and Gets Pushback
news.summary: John Thornton, former Goldman Sachs president, threw out the mining rulebook when he took over Barrick Gold Corp., cutting costs and selling assets when its rivals were doing the opposite. Debt is down, profits are up but the stock has tanked and reserves are shrinking.

news.title: MoviePass Slashes Offering to Three Films a Month
news.summary: Short on cash, battered by investors and pronounced dead by critics recently, MoviePass will soon begin limiting customers to three movies a month, a major change from its current allowance of one a day.

news.title: GM Cuts Different Type of Health-Care Deal
news.summary: General Motors has struck a deal with a Detroit-based hospital system to offer a new coverage option to employees, upending the traditional benefits setup in an attempt to lower costs and improve care.

news.title: A Team Comfortable With Letting Trump Be Trump
news.summary: The most important people around President Trump these days are four top advisers who come from quite different backgrounds, but have one thing in common: They are contemporaries of the 72-year-old president.

news.title: Tourists Flee Indonesian Island After Earthquake as Search for Survivors Continues
news.summary: Visitors struggled to get away from the vacation area as local crews evacuated local residents after the earthquake that killed around 100 people.
news.byline: Ben Otto and I Made Sentana

news.title: Don’t Worry About the End of QE, Worry About Rates
news.summary: The Federal Reserve is putting quantitative easing into reverse, but investors should focus instead on interest rates.

news.title: Who’s Super Stoked About Spikeball? Beach Bros—and Mennonites
news.summary: Turns out the best players of the oceanside game are in Lancaster County, Pa., where Amish and Mennonites share a passion with dudes in board shorts; ‘The Hand of God’ brings a win.

news.title: Oil Shocks Changed the Auto Industry; Tariffs Could Change It Again
news.summary: To understand why auto tariffs are such a contentious issue today, it helps to go back to the 1970s—with U.S. carmakers dominating the country’s auto market, Japan’s export growth on the horizon, and impending conflict in the Middle East.

news.title: Apple, Other Tech Firms Remove Links to Infowars
news.summary: Several big tech companies including Apple removed links from the controversial far-right website Infowars.

news.title: Profits Soar at Big U.S. Companies as Economy Advances
news.summary: America’s biggest companies are reporting some of the strongest earnings growth since the recession, boosted by lowered tax rates and a robust U.S. economy.

news.title: SeaWorld Shares Surge as Attendance Picks Up
news.summary: SeaWorld Entertainment reported better-than-expected revenue for the second quarter, helped in part by Sesame Street-themed events and free beer promotions at certain locations.

news.title: Newell Brands Lowers Guidance for Fourth Time in a Year
news.summary: Newell Brands blamed a chilly spring and the restructuring of big office stores for unexpectedly weak sales, as it cut its profit forecast for the fourth time in a year.

news.title: New FDIC Leader Joins Push to Re-Evaluate Banking Rules
news.summary: Jelena McWilliams, chairman of the FDIC, says in her first interview since her swearing-in that she is ready to re-evaluate rules on bank capital, small-dollar loans and investments in low-income areas.

news.title: Insurers Worry About Mistakes as They Speed Up Claims
news.summary: Property insurers are relying on more drones, small aircraft and artificial intelligence to accelerate claims this hurricane season. There are signs this push for speed could pose new headaches for the industry.

news.title: China’s Softer Stance on Defaults Spurs Asian Bond Market
news.summary: Beijing’s easing policy for deleveraging and defaults has helped fuel a mini-revival across Asia’s credit markets, pushing up bond prices recently and sparking debt issuance.

news.title: AT&T Not Out of the Legal Woods Yet
news.summary: The Justice Department’s appeal of a judge’s decision to allow AT&T’s purchase of Time Warner is highly unusual, but the odds of it achieving at least a partial victory aren’t trivial.

news.title: Denmark Launches Criminal Probe of Danske Bank
news.summary: Denmark’s public prosecutor for special economic crime has begun a criminal investigation against Danske Bank for potential money-laundering offenses.

news.title: GAM Says Suspended Fund Manager Breached Entertainment Policy
news.summary: Swiss money manager GAM Holding said that the star fund manager it suspended last week breached the firm’s gifts and entertainment policy, may have failed to carry out due diligence on investments, and used his personal email for work purposes.

news.title: U.S. Corporate Tax Cuts Likely to Hit Other Countries’ Bottom Lines
news.summary: Last year’s corporate tax cut in the U.S. will reduce what other countries collect from multinational corporations, say economists at the IMF.

news.title: Paul Invites Russian Lawmakers to Washington
news.summary: Sen. Rand Paul (R., Ky.) met with Russian lawmakers and invited them to Washington as part of a growing outreach to the Kremlin following President Trump’s summit with Russian leader Vladimir Putin last month.

news.title: Saudi Arabia’s Spat With Canada Risks Backlash From Investors
news.summary: Saudi Arabia’s diplomatic rupture with Canada is compounding a volatile business climate for a country that is seeking to overhaul its economy but has struggled to woo foreign investors.

news.title: Independence Talk Tests Limits of Free Speech in Hong Kong
news.summary: A planned talk by the leader of a tiny political group promoting Hong Kong’s independence from China is becoming a test of the city’s autonomy from Beijing.

news.title: Trump Associates Legal Fund Raised Over $200,000 in Quarter
news.summary: The funds for the Patriot Legal Expense Fund Trust came mostly from a trio of longtime Trump allies, according to new tax filings reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

news.title: White House Weighing Former Enforcement Lawyer for Democratic SEC Seat
news.summary: Allison Lee would replace Kara Stein, who has served on the commission since 2013 and must step down at the end of the year.

news.title: Trump Backs Challenger to Kansas GOP Governor
news.summary: President Trump endorsed Kris Kobach in the Kansas gubernatorial race, boosting the Republican as he challenges the state’s incumbent GOP governor in Tuesday’s primary.

news.title: Will the Smartphone Ever Truly Replace Your Beloved Wallet?
news.summary: When “there’s an app” for everything, the contents of our wallets—cash, mementos, timeworn IDs—are giving way to slick digital replacements. Six writers consider why it’s bittersweet to say goodbye to the billfold.

news.title: The Eight Best Predictors of the Long-Term Market
news.summary: Here are the stock indicators with the enviable track records—and the cautionary tale that they tell.

news.title: How Investors Can Cash In on the M&A Boom
news.summary: Mutual funds and ETFs let individuals play the merger-arbitrage game once reserved for hedge funds and professional traders.

news.title: William Shatner Reveals His Best and Worst Personal Investments
news.summary: Best Bet/Worst Bet: The “Star Trek” actor got rich on Priceline stock, before his gains vaporized.

news.title: Iranians Protest Economic Woes as New U.S. Sanctions Loom
news.summary: Thousands of protesters have taken to Iran’s streets in recent days in the biggest wave of unrest since January, appealing for financial help and calling for leadership changes as the U.S. prepares to impose new sanctions on the country.
news.byline: Asa Fitch in Dubai and Aresu Eqbali in Tehran

news.title: Iran and Its Oil Buyers Prepare for Return of U.S. Sanctions
news.summary: The Trump administration expects Iran’s oil buyers to begin winding down their purchases Tuesday. But countries including China, India and France are considering creative measures to keep importing Iranian crude.

news.title: Philippine Call Centers Try to Put Threat of Automation on Hold
news.summary: Outsourcing industry leaders are trying to stave off the threat to their business by training staffers to handle more-specialized tasks, while letting the bots do the grunt work.

news.title: Scores Killed in Latest Indonesian Earthquake
news.summary: A magnitude 7.0 quake has killed at least 91 people, injured hundreds and displaced thousands of others on and around the popular tourist island of Lombok.

news.title: Saudi Arabia Expels Canadian Ambassador
news.summary: Saudi Arabia said it has expelled Canada’s ambassador and recalled its own envoy after the government in Ottawa expressed concern over arrests of civil-society and women’s rights activists in the kingdom.

news.title: Asian Nations Push Back at U.S. on Trade, Sanctions
news.summary: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo faced criticism from China and skepticism from Southeast Asian powers over U.S. trade policies, as well as a warning from North Korea about Washington’s approach to talks, at a weekend meeting of regional leaders.

news.title: Venezuela Attack Raises Crackdown Fears
news.summary: Venezuelan authorities said they arrested six suspects tied to an alleged plan to assassinate President Nicolás Maduro. Critics warned that Mr. Maduro could use the purported plot as a pretext to intensify a crackdown on dissidents.

news.title: In Canada’s Grocery Carts, a Boycott U.S.A. Movement Starts Rolling ​
news.summary: Canadians irked by U.S. metals tariffs and President Trump’s harsh words for their prime minister are boycotting American products and buying Canadian goods.

news.title: Iranians Hoard Gold Ahead of U.S. Sanctions
news.summary: Iranians are hoarding gold as a safeguard against a collapsing local currency and soaring cost of living as the U.S. is poised to impose economic sanctions on Iran, pushing the metal’s price to record highs in Tehran.
news.byline: Asa Fitch in Dubai and Aresu Eqbali in Tehran

news.title: South Sudan Leaders Make Another Attempt at Peace
news.summary: South Sudan’s leaders signed a peace and power-sharing agreement, the latest attempt to stop a civil war and humanitarian disaster in the world’s youngest nation.

news.title: Argentina to Vote on Loosening Strict Abortion Laws
news.summary: Argentina’s Senate is expected to vote on a bill that, if approved, would allow women to end a pregnancy in the first 14 weeks.

news.title: Suicide Bomber Kills Three NATO Members in Afghanistan
news.summary: A Taliban suicide bomber killed three NATO service members on a foot patrol in eastern Afghanistan on Sunday in an attack that also wounded a U.S. soldier and two Afghan troops, NATO said.

news.title: Venezuela Says Drone Attack Targeted President Maduro
news.summary: Explosives carried by drones were detonated near Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro and his entourage at a military ceremony Saturday in what he called an assassination attempt by right-wing foes.

news.title: Turkey Responds to Sanctions Over Pastor’s Detainment
news.summary: The dispute pitting the U.S. against NATO ally Turkey over the fate of an American pastor escalated, with Turkey’s President Erdogan vowing to retaliate against U.S. sanctions.
news.byline: Yeliz Candemir in Istanbul and Jessica Donati in Singapore

news.title: North Korea Warns U.S. of Difficulties Over Nuclear Deal
news.summary: North Korea warned its nuclear agreement with President Trump “will face difficulties” unless the U.S. took steps to build trust.

news.title: Trump Replies to ‘Nice’ Letter From North Korea’s Kim
news.summary: The U.S. State Department said it delivered a letter from President Trump to North Korean leader Kim Jong Un during a regional summit.

news.title: Trump Defends Son’s Meeting With Russian Lawyer
news.summary: President Trump acknowledged that a meeting his son held with a Russian government lawyer in June 2016 was an attempt “to get information on” Hillary Clinton but defended it as “totally legal.”

news.title: Senators Signal Concerns Over China’s Global Investments
news.summary: Several U.S. senators are pressing the Trump administration to detail what it is doing to deal with Beijing’s financing of international infrastructure projects that have left many countries indebted and potentially in need of bailouts.

news.title: Manafort Judge Sets a Brisk Pace for Prosecutors
news.summary: U.S. District Judge T.S. Ellis has consistently reined in prosecutors for special counsel Robert Mueller as they introduced evidence in the trial against ex-Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort, forcing them to focus on core allegations.
news.byline: Del Quentin Wilber and Aruna Viswanatha

news.title: House Republicans Strike Out to Outsiders in State Races
news.summary: When Tennessee Rep. Diane Black placed third in her state’s GOP race for governor last week, she became the fifth House Republican defeated in a statewide primary this year.
news.byline: Reid J. Epstein and Kristina Peterson

news.title: What Ohio’s Special Election Says About the Midterms
news.summary: President Trump held a rally in central Ohio to shore up support for a Republican House candidate who has struggled to raise money and is failing to motivate GOP voters.

news.title: ‘Never In My Wildest Dreams’: GOP Candidates Find Key to Winning Trump’s Strong Praise
news.summary: President Trump’s imprimatur at an arena packed with thousands of energetic voters can help build momentum for Republican hopefuls.

news.title: Manafort Accountant Testifies Tax Returns Contained False Information
news.summary: An accountant for Paul Manafort told jurors Friday she believed his tax returns contained inaccurate information and falsely reduced his tax liability by classifying millions in income as loans.
news.byline: Aruna Viswanatha, Del Quentin Wilber and Alexa Corse

news.title: Top Democrats Plan to Meet With Supreme Court Nominee Kavanaugh
news.summary: Top Senate Democrats plan to meet with Brett Kavanaugh, after holding off on sitdowns due to a dispute over documents related to his work in the George W. Bush White House.

news.title: With Eyes on 2020, Democrats Weigh In on Georgia Governor’s Race
news.summary: Democrats expected to compete for the 2020 presidential nomination are stepping up for their party’s gubernatorial candidate in Georgia, as they seek to avoid the kind of drubbing Sen. Bernie Sanders suffered in the South in 2016.

news.title: House Panel to Invite Twitter CEO to Testify
news.summary: A House panel plans to invite Twitter chief Jack Dorsey to testify about the social media company’s algorithms and decisions about content and data.

news.title: July Jobs Report Likely to Keep Fed on Track for Next Rate Increase
news.summary: The July employment report is likely to keep the Federal Reserve on track to raise interest rates at its next meeting in September, and does little to alter the outlook for gradually rising rates after that.

news.title: Bottle Shock: Treasury Challenges Tax Break for Wine Importers
news.summary: The Trump administration is challenging a tax benefit that gives the wine industry up to $69 million annually and blocking beer and spirits makers from using the same break.

news.title: U.S. Officials Warn of Russian Efforts to Disrupt 2018 Vote
news.summary: Senior intelligence officials described Russian efforts to interfere in the 2018 midterm elections as deep, real and ongoing, showcasing their efforts to combat a threat President Trump has repeatedly dismissed.

news.title: Bill Lee Wins GOP Primary for Tennessee Governor
news.summary: Construction executive Bill Lee won the Republican primary for Tennessee governor, the Associated Press projected, in a race featuring four major candidates.
news.byline: Reid J. Epstein and Kristina Peterson

news.title: Money Fuels Fight to Overturn Anti-Union Law in Missouri
news.summary: Unions are outspending opponents in a bid to defeat a right-to-work law in Missouri ahead of a referendum that will serve as a barometer of popular support for organized labor.

news.title: New York’s Ride-Hailing Battlefield Is in the Outer Boroughs
news.summary: Uber and Lyft say outer-borough residents would be the hardest hit if New York City stops granting new ride-hailing licenses

news.title: Feud Escalates Between Cuomo and the NRA
news.summary: A feud between New York’s governor and the National Rifle Association escalated over the weekend, with Andrew Cuomo accusing the group of political bullying and the gun organization saying it could suffer financially if the state’s actions remained unchecked.

news.title: U.S. Pushes New Penalties for Russian Grid Hackers
news.summary: Top administration officials are devising new penalties to hit back more forcefully at state-sponsored hackers of infrastructure to deter attacks such as the penetration of U.S. utilities by Russian agents last year.

news.title: New Lead in ‘The Band’s Visit’ Should Sound Familiar
news.summary: When Broadway shows look to replace a star, they try to bring in another big name. Sasson Gabay, Tony Shalhoub’s replacement in the Tony winner, is unknown to Americans—but he actually starred in the movie that inspired the show.

news.title: MTA’s Cost-Saving Paratransit Program Proves Too Popular, Runs Up Big Tab
news.summary: E-hail app allows paratransit customers to book a car at a moment’s notice, giving them independence and flexibility.

news.title: After Harvey, Houston Hopes Bond Will Boost Flood Defense
news.summary: A year after Hurricane Harvey, Houston-area residents are set to vote on whether to overhaul the region’s beleaguered flood-protection system, an election that local officials have cast as critical to the area’s future.

news.title: Unions’ Fees Take a Hit After Decision From Supreme Court
news.summary: Public-sector unions are facing steep falls in revenue and trying to prevent the loss of members in the wake of a recent Supreme Court ruling.

news.title: President Trump Blasts LeBron James
news.summary: President Trump unleashed a withering attack on NBA star LeBron James in a late-night tweet that derided the intelligence of one of the nation’s most prominent African-American men.

news.title: Study Shows Scores on Elite High School Test Predict Success
news.summary: A new puzzle piece emerged in the fractious debate over how to fairly admit students to some of New York City’s most sought-after public high schools.

news.title: 911 Emergency: Call Centers Can’t Find Workers
news.summary: Cities across the U.S. are struggling to find 911 dispatchers as a historically tight labor market makes it harder to fill a job that was already a tough sell.

news.title: Rare ‘Fire Whirl’ Landed in California
news.summary: California fire officials say they are investigating damage stemming from an unusually large fire tornado that occurred over the city of Redding on July 26.

news.title: Judge Orders U.S. to Find Deported Immigrant Parents

news.summary: A federal jury awarded more than $470 million to six neighbors who live near a hog farm run by a contractor for pork giant Smithfield Foods, the third lawsuit in a row the company has lost for odor and noise created by hog farming.

news.title: Kushner Family Closes Deal to Unload 666 Fifth Avenue
news.summary: In a larger-than-expected deal, Kushner Cos. will lease the building to Brookfield Asset Management for 99 years. The 2007 investment, worth $1.8 billion at the time, became controversial when Jared Kushner joined the Trump White House.

news.title: Texas Grand Jury Indicts Chemical Company for Harvey Explosion
news.summary: A grand jury in Texas has indicted a chemical company whose plant near Houston caught fire and exploded following Hurricane Harvey last year.

news.title: Police Report on Las Vegas Gunman Finds No Motive for Attack
news.summary: A Las Vegas police report on gunman Stephen Paddock, who killed 58 people in the deadliest mass shooting in modern U.S. history last year, turns up new details about his life, but no firm motive for the crime.

news.title: Met Opera Reaches Labor Deal With Singers, Musicians
news.summary: The Metropolitan Opera in New York City has reached a tentative agreement with the unions representing its musicians and singers, avoiding the kind of contentious public battle that ensued during contract negotiations in 2014.

news.title: Delays Plague NJ Transit This Summer
news.summary: NJ Transit commuters are having to contend with last-minute cancellations and overcrowded trains as the railroad struggles with a summer of equipment and staff shortages

news.title: Temple Staff and Alumni Demand Answers on M.B.A. Rankings Scandal
news.summary: Temple University alumni and staff are voicing frustration with how administrators have handled a brewing M.B.A.-rankings scandal that has prompted federal and state investigations.

news.title: Arista to Pay Cisco $400 Million as Companies Settle IP Disputes
news.summary: The companies have been battling in court for several years over intellectual property and antitrust claims.

news.title: Microsoft Surface Go Review: Small Computer, Big Compromise
news.summary: Microsoft’s cheapest Surface yet tries to be both laptop and tablet. But in trying to be a perfect hand-held tablet and a powerhouse laptop, the Go risks getting neither right, writes David Pierce.

news.title: Taiwan Semiconductor Expects Revenue Hit After Computer Virus
news.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor, which supplies chips for tech companies including Apple and Qualcomm, said it has fully eliminated an infection of its computer systems by a modified version of a virus that last year crippled hundreds of thousands of computers around the world.

news.title: China’s Didi Bets $1 Billion on Auto-Services Sector
news.summary: Didi Chuxing will invest $1 billion in its auto-services business and break it off into a separate unit, as the company seeks to expand beyond ride-hailing in the world’s biggest automotive market.

news.title: Asia’s FANG Stocks Have Outsize Sway
news.summary: Tencent, Samsung and other Asian tech giants dominate their markets, which recently has led to losses for investors and broader stock-benchmark declines.

news.title: SoftBank Finds Selling Has Some Upsides, Too
news.summary: SoftBank has seemingly been buying everything in the technology world in the past year. Sometimes, it’s good to sell.

news.title: Bigger Sales Than Apple? China’s Huawei Doesn’t Need the U.S.
news.summary: Smartphone sales are falling globally, but a Chinese tech giant whose devices most Americans can’t even buy is doing booming business, while nipping at the heels of Apple.

news.title: Cryptocurrency ‘Pump and Dumps’ Distort Trading
news.summary: Dozens of trading groups are manipulating the price of cryptocurrencies on some of the largest online exchanges, generating at least $825 million in trading activity over the past six months—and big losses for those caught on the wrong side, according to a Wall Street Journal analysis.

news.title: Tech Costs Force Honda to Let Go of Engineering Legacy
news.summary: The car maker is outsourcing key tech for electric vehicles and autonomous driving to fight high R&D costs.

news.title: Should Artificial Intelligence Copy the Human Brain?
news.summary: The biggest breakthrough in AI, deep learning, has hit a wall, and a debate is raging about how to get to the next level.

news.title: Past Social-Media Posts Upend Hiring
news.summary: More companies are scouring job candidates’ online personas for racist and other red-flag comments. That hasn’t kept social-media histories from morphing into hiring minefields.

news.title: Samsung Tries to Navigate Through U.S.-China Trade Crossfire
news.summary: The U.S.-China trade fight has put South Korea’s Samsung Electronics in an uncomfortable spot. Its challenge: to manage its ties to both countries without getting caught in the crossfire, even as U.S. tariffs threaten its sales of home appliances and device components.

news.title: Ousted Tech Founder? Uber’s Travis Kalanick Is in Good Company
news.summary: Uber co-Founder Travis Kalanick joins an illustrious list of Silicon Valley leaders forced out of running the companies they built.

news.title: Uber’s Really Bad Year
news.summary: Uber CEO Travis Kalanick’s resignation follows a turbulent few months for both him and the company he founded. Here’s a quick glance at the events that preceded the 40-year-old’s departure.

news.title: Big Pay, Short Stays for Hardware Chiefs
news.summary: Four of the 21 largest semiconductor and hardware firms in the S&P 500 sector switched CEOs this year, and some of them were among the highest paid in the industry, according to a WSJ analysis.

news.title: How China Is Evolving From Copycat Medicines to Maker of Complex Drugs
news.summary: Johnson & Johnson was so impressed by a Chinese startup’s work on an experimental gene therapy it paid $350 million for the global rights to the cancer treatment.

news.title: Apple’s Rise to $1 Trillion Fueled by iPhone’s Success
news.summary: Apple’s milestone underscores the iPhone maker’s explosive growth and its role in fueling the rise of the tech industry to the forefront of the global economy.

news.title: SoftBank’s Operating Profit Jumps 49%, Boosted by Vision Fund
news.summary: Rising valuations on investments in startups such Indian e-commerce company Flipkart and U.S. shared-office firm WeWork gave Softbank’s quarterly operating profit a lift.

news.title: For Tesla’s Elon Musk, Twitter Is Sword Against Short Sellers
news.summary: Elon Musk’s extraordinary use of Twitter to battle short sellers has often been followed by a jump in Tesla’s stock price, hurting shorts in the process.

news.title: Cisco Adds to Cybersecurity Offerings With Purchase of Duo
news.summary: Cisco Systems agreed to pay $2.35 billion for privately held Duo Security, a move intended to bolster cybersecurity offerings at the networking gear giant.

news.title: Google’s Road Back to China Littered With Obstacles
news.summary: Google’s development of a censor-friendly mobile search app sent shares of China’s dominant search engine plunging, but it still faces hurdles gaining re-entry into the country.
news.byline: Liza Lin in Shanghai and Shan Li in Beijing

news.title: Fake Accounts Latched On to Real U.S. Protest Groups
news.summary: Organizers of fake Facebook accounts sought to work alongside legitimate groups organizing protests in the U.S., a new strategy in efforts to sow discord through social media.

news.title: Google Considering Return to China With Censored Search
news.summary: Google is testing a mobile version of its search engine that would adhere to China’s strict controls over content, a person familiar with the matter said, indicating renewed interest in a market it abandoned eight years ago in protest over government censorship.

news.title: Tesla Puts Profits in Its Sights This Year
news.summary: Tesla doubled its loss in the second quarter but burned less cash than expected, alleviating some pressure as the electric-car maker seeks to deliver a profit later this year.

news.title: Square Report Smaller Loss as Consumer Push Intensifies
news.summary: Jack Dorsey’s Square Inc. said on Wednesday that its second-quarter loss narrowed by nearly two-thirds thanks in part to uptake of its consumer financial services.

news.title: Facebook’s New Message to WhatsApp: Make Money
news.summary: WhatsApp detailed plans to sell ads and charge big companies that want to reach their customers through its service, launching its first major revenue streams as growth at Facebook’s main app is starting to decelerate.

news.title: New Facebook and Instagram Tools Aim to Curb Your Binge
news.summary: As part of a larger trend of tech companies helping to wean users off their more-addictive products, Facebook has announced new tools that tally time spent and nudge you when it’s time for a break.

news.title: Resistance Builds to Google’s ‘Smart City’ in Toronto
news.summary: An Alphabet project aimed at creating a “smart city” on Toronto’s waterfront is facing resistance from local officials who are worried about the development’s direction and how Google’s parent company will handle residents’ personal data.

news.title: High Prices Propel Apple, Sink Samsung
news.summary: Apple and Samsung are betting on super-high prices for their flagship products. The strategy has energized Apple but sapped Samsung’s sales.

news.title: Amcor Agrees to Buy Bemis in Stock Deal
news.summary: Amcor Ltd. has agreed to buy packaging competitor Bemis Co. in an all-stock deal that the companies value at $6.8 billion.

news.title: Tyson Foods Reports Higher Profit as Sales Tick Up
news.summary: Tyson Foods reported that its third-quarter profit rose from a year ago, a week after announcing it was trimming its outlook for the year because of factors including commodity market volatility and tariffs.

news.title: Meet PepsiCo’s Next CEO: Ramon Laguarta
news.summary: Ramon Laguarta is set to take the helm of PepsiCo as the maker of Lay’s potato chips and Mountain Dew continues to expand its offerings in response to rapidly shifting consumer tastes.

news.title: ‘Mission: Impossible’ Wins Out Over Winnie-the-Pooh at Box Office
news.summary: Tom Cruise sped past Winnie-the-Pooh at the box office to lead all films for the second straight week with an estimated $35 million in ticket sales for “Mission: Impossible—Fallout.”

news.title: China’s Cleanup Efforts Create Boom for South African Miner
news.summary: China’s efforts to curb the smog in its cities and clean up its steel industry are remaking the global iron-ore market—to the benefit of miners such as Anglo American subsidiary Kumba, which produces high-grade ore.
news.byline: Alexandra Wexler in Kathu, South Africa and Rhiannon Hoyle in Sydney, Australia

news.title: Hospital System, CEO to Pay $65 Million to Settle Lawsuit
news.summary: Prime Healthcare Services and its CEO will pay $65 million to settle allegations the California-based hospital system unnecessarily admitted Medicare patients and falsely billed the federal health-insurance program.

news.title: SEC Drops Probe of Exxon’s Disclosures on Climate Change
news.summary: The SEC dropped a probe into whether Exxon Mobil misled investors about the risks that climate change and greenhouse-gas regulations posed to its business.

news.title: Weinstein’s Lawyers Say Emails Show Consensual Relationship, Not Rape
news.summary: Lawyers for Harvey Weinstein are asking a judge to toss criminal sex-crime charges, citing an extensive and affectionate email correspondence between the onetime powerful Hollywood producer and his alleged rape victim.

news.title: Logistics Payrolls Surging Ahead of Fall Shipping Season
news.summary: Transportation and warehousing companies added 15,600 jobs in July even as hiring in the broader U.S. economy cooled.

news.title: U.S. Stocks Rise on Robust Earnings Season
news.summary: The S&P 500 climbed for the fourth time in the past five sessions, lifted by the latest flurry of corporate earnings.
news.byline: Amrith Ramkumar and Ben St. Clair

news.title: Oil Rises Amid Signs of Falling Saudi Output
news.summary: Oil prices ticked up Monday morning on the back of reports that Saudi Arabian crude output unexpectedly fell in July.

news.title: Turkish Lira Falls to Fresh Lows Against U.S. Dollar
news.summary: The Turkish lira weakened to new record lows against the U.S. dollar Monday after the country’s central bank tried to stem the currency’s decline by reducing two reserve requirements.

news.title: U.S. Government Bonds Rise Before Auctions
news.summary: The yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note retreated further from 3% Monday, weighed down by recent trade friction and weaker-then-expected economic data.

news.title: Dollar Reaches Highest Level in Two Weeks
news.summary: The U.S. dollar rose as investors bet renewed trade tensions and last week’s round of solid economic data would continue to boost the currency.

news.title: Big Tech’s Path to $4 Trillion
news.summary: Apple’s $1 trillion milestone is a harbinger for rising tech giants Amazon, Alphabet and Microsoft.

news.title: The Bumps on HSBC’s Road to Better Growth
news.summary: HSBC’s transition to growth is costly and slower than some would like, but under the hood, the bank is building the future earnings power it promised.

news.title: The Unseen Risk in the Booming Loan Market

Real Estate.title: A Modern East Hampton Retreat for the Family
Real Estate.summary: This house on Long Island, N.Y., has a pool, tennis court and wild blueberries. It is listed for $2.25 million.

Real Estate.title: Mario Andretti: From Italian Refugee Camp to the Winner’s Circle at Indy
Real Estate.summary: The auto-racing legend’s love for fast cars began in Lucca, Italy, before making his way to Nazareth, Pa., and the discovery of a local stock-car track.

Real Estate.title: A Rustic Family Barn in California
Real Estate.summary: Envisioned as a modern farmhouse, this Napa Valley residence was also built to be child-friendly. It is asking $7.95 million.

Real Estate.title: Luxury Homes That Promise to Reduce Stress—For $4 Million
Real Estate.summary: Luxury developers are touting wellness real estate, offering private and communal spaces for meditation and yoga.

Real Estate.title: 10 Decorators’ Best and Worst Buys
Real Estate.summary: Design professionals reveal the smartest décor purchases they’ve ever made (midcentury finds on Craigslist), and the most regrettable (a stinky ottoman). What you can learn from their admissions.

Real Estate.title: A New Career and House With the Help of Over 1 Million Instagram Fans
Real Estate.summary: Kate Rumson of The Real Houses of Instagram designed her New Jersey townhouse by polling her 1.8 million social-media fans on chandelier choice and the right furniture.

Real Estate.title: A New York Weekend Island Retreat Gets Fancy
Real Estate.summary: Luxury homes are replacing tiny bungalows as wealthy buyers look to Bohemian Fire Island as an affordable Hamptons alternative.

Economy.title: U.S. Corporate Tax Cuts Likely to Hit Other Countries’ Bottom Lines
Economy.summary: Last year’s corporate tax cut in the U.S. will reduce what other countries collect from multinational corporations, say economists at the IMF.

US.title: Money Fuels Fight to Overturn Anti-Union Law in Missouri
US.summary: Unions are outspending opponents in a bid to defeat a right-to-work law in Missouri ahead of a referendum that will serve as a barometer of popular support for organized labor.

US.title: New York’s Ride-Hailing Battlefield Is in the Outer Boroughs
US.summary: Uber and Lyft say outer-borough residents would be the hardest hit if New York City stops granting new ride-hailing licenses

US.title: Feud Escalates Between Cuomo and the NRA
US.summary: A feud between New York’s governor and the National Rifle Association escalated over the weekend, with Andrew Cuomo accusing the group of political bullying and the gun organization saying it could suffer financially if the state’s actions remained unchecked.

US.title: U.S. Pushes New Penalties for Russian Grid Hackers
US.summary: Top administration officials are devising new penalties to hit back more forcefully at state-sponsored hackers of infrastructure to deter attacks such as the penetration of U.S. utilities by Russian agents last year.

US.title: New Lead in ‘The Band’s Visit’ Should Sound Familiar
US.summary: When Broadway shows look to replace a star, they try to bring in another big name. Sasson Gabay, Tony Shalhoub’s replacement in the Tony winner, is unknown to Americans—but he actually starred in the movie that inspired the show.

US.title: MTA’s Cost-Saving Paratransit Program Proves Too Popular, Runs Up Big Tab
US.summary: E-hail app allows paratransit customers to book a car at a moment’s notice, giving them independence and flexibility.

US.title: After Harvey, Houston Hopes Bond Will Boost Flood Defense
US.summary: A year after Hurricane Harvey, Houston-area residents are set to vote on whether to overhaul the region’s beleaguered flood-protection system, an election that local officials have cast as critical to the area’s future.

US.title: Unions’ Fees Take a Hit After Decision From Supreme Court
US.summary: Public-sector unions are facing steep falls in revenue and trying to prevent the loss of members in the wake of a recent Supreme Court ruling.

US.title: President Trump Blasts LeBron James
US.summary: President Trump unleashed a withering attack on NBA star LeBron James in a late-night tweet that derided the intelligence of one of the nation’s most prominent African-American men.

US.title: Study Shows Scores on Elite High School Test Predict Success
US.summary: A new puzzle piece emerged in the fractious debate over how to fairly admit students to some of New York City’s most sought-after public high schools.

US.title: 911 Emergency: Call Centers Can’t Find Workers
US.summary: Cities across the U.S. are struggling to find 911 dispatchers as a historically tight labor market makes it harder to fill a job that was already a tough sell.

US.title: Rare ‘Fire Whirl’ Landed in California
US.summary: California fire officials say they are investigating damage stemming from an unusually large fire tornado that occurred over the city of Redding on July 26.

US.title: Judge Orders U.S. to Find Deported Immigrant Parents
US.summary: A federal judge said the Trump administration is responsible for finding hundreds of immigrant parents deported or released into the U.S. without their children in the wake of the government’s policy of separating families at the Mexican border.

US.title: Smithfield Ordered to Pay in Hog Case
US.summary: A federal jury awarded more than $470 million to six neighbors who live near a hog farm run by a contractor for pork giant Smithfield Foods, the third lawsuit in a row the company has lost for odor and noise created by hog farming.

US.title: Kushner Family Closes Deal to Unload 666 Fifth Avenue
US.summary: In a larger-than-expected deal, Kushner Cos. will lease the building to Brookfield Asset Management for 99 years. The 2007 investment, worth $1.8 billion at the time, became controversial when Jared Kushner joined the Trump White House.

US.title: Texas Grand Jury Indicts Chemical Company for Harvey Explosion
US.summary: A grand jury in Texas has indicted a chemical company whose plant near Houston caught fire and exploded following Hurricane Harvey last year.

US.title: Police Report on Las Vegas Gunman Finds No Motive for Attack
US.summary: A Las Vegas police report on gunman Stephen Paddock, who killed 58 people in the deadliest mass shooting in modern U.S. history last year, turns up new details about his life, but no firm motive for the crime.

US.title: Met Opera Reaches Labor Deal With Singers, Musicians
US.summary: The Metropolitan Opera in New York City has reached a tentative agreement with the unions representing its musicians and singers, avoiding the kind of contentious public battle that ensued during contract negotiations in 2014.

US.title: Delays Plague NJ Transit This Summer
US.summary: NJ Transit commuters are having to contend with last-minute cancellations and overcrowded trains as the railroad struggles with a summer of equipment and staff shortages

US.title: Temple Staff and Alumni Demand Answers on M.B.A. Rankings Scandal
US.summary: Temple University alumni and staff are voicing frustration with how administrators have handled a brewing M.B.A.-rankings scandal that has prompted federal and state investigations.

US.title: Unions’ Fees Take a Hit After Decision From Supreme Court
US.summary: Public-sector unions are facing steep falls in revenue and trying to prevent the loss of members in the wake of a recent Supreme Court ruling.

US.title: Viewers Cut the Cable TV Cord Faster Than Expected
US.summary: Research firm estimates the ranks of U.S. cord-cutters will grow this year by 8 million, or nearly 33%, to 33 million.

US.title: Trump Organization Finance Chief Called to Testify Before Grand Jury
US.summary: Allen Weisselberg, a longtime financial gatekeeper for President Trump, has been subpoenaed to testify in the criminal probe of Mr. Trump’s former personal lawyer, Michael Cohen.

Pro Bankruptcy.title: Private-Equity Firm Silver Lake Offers to Invest $500 Million in iHeartMedia
Pro Bankruptcy.summary: Private-equity firm Silver Lake has reached out to iHeartMedia and its largest creditor group with an offer to invest about $500 million in the radio station operator.

CSuite.title: The Morning Download: A Road Atlas for the Blockchain Landscape
CSuite.summary: Every so often, like maybe one or twice a week, the world of blockchain and cryptocurrencies forks in one new direction too many, and it’s time to step back and assess where things stand.

CSuite.title: Tech Hiring Rebounds in July
CSuite.summary: After shedding IT jobs for four consecutive months, U.S. employers last month added 75,000 new IT workers and posted more ads for open tech positions, CompTIA reports.

CSuite.title: The Emergence of a Blockchain-Based Token Economy
CSuite.summary: The internet was designed to move information, but it’s lacked the necessary trust, security and privacy safeguards to move assets of value, CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger writes.  With blockchain, we’re now seeing the emergence of such an internet of value.

CSuite.title: Experian Enlists Machine Learning to Gauge App Performance
CSuite.summary: Just as manufacturing firms add sensors to monitor the performance of generators and compressors, Experian is using machine learning to create behavior models of applications. When data indicates behavior outside the normal range, application or infrastructure teams receive an alert. “I would equate this to predictive maintenance,” said CIO Barry Libenson.

CSuite.title: Microsoft Narrows Gap with Amazon in Cloud
CSuite.summary: Though Amazon maintains a commanding lead in cloud infrastructure, the software gian nearly doubled its share of the market, Gartner reports.

CSuite.title: In Rush Toward ‘Digital Transformation,’ Corporations Often Skirt IT
CSuite.summary: In the rush to deploy AI, automation and other tools for business-side divisions, many corporate IT units are neglecting their own digital upgrades, a Hackett Group report says.  That can spell trouble for the entire company.

CSuite.title: Lockheed Martin Deploys Augmented Reality for Spacecraft Manufacturing
CSuite.summary: Lockheed Martin’s space division is using augmented reality headsets and software to speed up the time it takes for engineers to learn about and conduct manufacturing processes on spacecraft

CSuite.title: Farm to Cradle: Nestlé Experiments with Tracking Gerber Baby Food on the Blockchain
CSuite.summary: Nestlé SA is putting some of its Gerber baby food products on a food-tracking blockchain to test whether the technology can trace the fruits and vegetables that go into its purées and squeezable pouches.

CSuite.title: Hertz Names New CIO as Tech Overhaul Continues
CSuite.summary: Opal Perry joins the rental-car agency as it continues a massive consolidation of its business systems and prepares to roll out updated versions of its core technology.

CSuite.title: Firms to Boost Spending on Smart Automation
CSuite.summary: In the rush to deploy artificial intelligence and robotic process automation, many businesses lack the in-house skills or business strategies to make those investments pay off, KPMG says.

CSuite.title: Pentagon Signs $885 Million Artificial Intelligence Contract with Booz Allen
CSuite.summary: The U.S. Department of Defense will for the first time be using large-scale AI systems that could automate mundane tasks and augment the work of military members. The contract also will go toward expanding AI-focused pilot programs, including using AI to find new approaches for treating traumatic brain injuries.

CSuite.title: Microsoft CTO: Edge Computing Can Make Industries ‘Massively More Efficient’
CSuite.summary: “Any of these agricultural or industrial applications, where you have very manual processes like inspections, or humans gathering data … (that’s where) the intelligent edge is going to make those industries massively more efficient,” says Microsoft CTO Kevin Scott.

CSuite.title: What Machine Learning Can and Cannot Do
CSuite.summary: As its domain of applications continues to expand, machine learning is raising serious concerns on its impact on automation and the future of work, CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger writes.

CSuite.title: Dow Chemical Digital Chief Helps Shape Massive Restructuring
CSuite.summary: Melanie Kalmar, Dow Chemical’s CDO and CIO, is working closely with other senior leaders to create a new structure designed to help the 121-year-old company better compete in the 21st century. "We are focused on a whole new realm of digitalization – one where we are harnessing the power of our long history of data collection to drive growth and new business opportunities," she said.

CSuite.title: Rush to the Cloud Creates Risk of Overspending
CSuite.summary: By purchasing more cloud computing capacity then they really need, companies across all industries may be overspending on cloud services by an average of 42%, a cloud optimization firm finds.

CSuite.title: Dow Jones Develops Automated Security Tool
CSuite.summary: The new tool, called Hammer, was developed partly in response to the growing need for automation amid talent shortages and the fast-paced nature of software development, said Dow Jones CISO Jaswinder Hayre.

CSuite.title: Cloud Migration Set to Ramp Up in China
CSuite.summary: Compared to U.S. companies, businesses in China have been slower to embrace cloud computing, citing the cost and complexity of migrations, as well as added security and regulatory issues, McKinsey reports.

CSuite.title: Walmart CIO Looks to Microsoft Cloud as Vehicle in Digital Race
CSuite.summary: Walmart CIO Clay Johnson said the company’s new pact with Microsoft will allow the retailer to take advantage of artificial intelligence and cloud capabilities as it competes in a rapidly changing market.

CSuite.title: The Houston Astros and the Transformative Power of Analytics
CSuite.summary: The next wave in baseball? Quite possibly big data combined with AI, says CIO Journal Columnist Irving Wladawsky-Berger.

CSuite.title: Intuition, Emotional Skills of Humans Will Still Prevail in the Age of AI, Experts Say
CSuite.summary: Artificial intelligence is poised to help enterprises automate processes and quickly mine large quantities of data for insights, but human workers will still be invaluable, said panelists at an AI conference Wednesday.

CSuite.title: Huntsman Mulls Repatriating Overseas Cash for Bolt-On Deals
CSuite.summary: Specialty chemicals maker Huntsman Corp. is considering repatriating some of its overseas cash following the introduction of a new provision in the U.S. tax law, the company’s finance chief said.

CSuite.title: Akzo Nobel Bets on Data to Hike Prices
CSuite.summary: Dutch paints maker Akzo Nobel NV is continuing to raise prices to offset higher raw material costs, the company’s finance chief said.

CSuite.title: Old Dominion Goes On Hiring Spree, Boosted by Robust Demand
CSuite.summary: Old Dominion Freight Line Inc., one of the largest U.S. truckers, has increased its headcount by 16% over the last quarter as the expanding economy has spurred demand.

CSuite.title: Navient Readies For New Accounting Rules on Bad Loans
CSuite.summary: Navient Corp., one of the largest servicers of student loans, is preparing for a new accounting rule that requires lenders to project losses on bad loans quicker than current norms allow.

CSuite.title: Godiva Names Former Burberry Executive as New CFO
CSuite.summary: Godiva Chocolatier has hired Virginie Costa as chief financial officer at the Brussels-based maker of chocolates and other confectioneries.

CSuite.title: Investor Proposals Get Sharper, Garner More Support
CSuite.summary: Shareholder proposals -- a key tool that investors use to steer corporate decision making -- have fallen in number but are better at hitting the mark, according to a report by law firm Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP.

CSuite.title: New U.K. Governance Code Focuses on Reporting, Executive Remuneration
CSuite.summary: The U.K.’s largest companies were asked to improve the quality of their financial reporting as part of the new corporate governance rules released by the Financial Reporting Council on Monday.

CSuite.title: How CFO Paul Woolf Steered Mitie to a Turnaround
CSuite.summary: Mitie Group PLC’s rising revenue and improving order book are signs of turning fortunes for the struggling U.K. facility management company that finance chief Paul Woolf joined in November 2017.

CSuite.title: WD-40 Feels Little Impact from Trade Tensions
CSuite.summary: Trade tariffs ultimately hurt consumers and allow some companies to disguise unrelated price increases, said Jay Rembolt, finance chief of WD-40 Co.

CSuite.title: Earnings of Middle-Market Private Companies Jump 12.6% in Q2
CSuite.summary: Earnings growth surged for U.S. private middle-market companies in the first two months of the second quarter, according to a report by Golub Capital, a lender to these companies.

CSuite.title: Digital Transformation Could Add New Jobs – Survey
CSuite.summary: More finance chiefs are looking to add workers to aid in the transformation toward a more digital workplace rather than reduce headcount, according to new report.

CSuite.title: Tax Savings Boost Company Funding for Pensions
CSuite.summary: Finance chiefs are giving pension-risk transfers a second look after the U.S. tax overhaul and favorable tax treatment has spurred pension contributions.

CSuite.title: Philips Looks for Bolt-On Targets While Cutting Costs
CSuite.summary: Dutch technology company Koninklijke Philips NV is scouting for bolt-on acquisition targets while advancing its cost-savings program, Chief Financial Officer Abhijit Bhattacharya told CFO Journal.
